content.title: Crohn Disease
content.summary: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease characterized by transmural, granulomatous inflammation that can affect any part of the GI tract from mouth to anus, with skip lesions and propensity for strictures, fistulas, and abscesses
key_points: Can affect ANY part of GI tract - most common terminal ileum
Skip lesions - normal bowel between diseased segments
Non-caseating granulomas (pathognomonic but not always present)

statement.text: Crohn disease is a chronic IBD characterized by transmural granulomatous inflammation affecting any GI tract location, most commonly terminal ileum and colon. Features skip lesions, transmural inflammation leading to fistulas and strictures, and non-caseating granulomas. Patients present with abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, and extraintestinal manifestations.
statement.formal: Crohn = Transmural + Skip lesions + Any GI location ± Granulomas | Complications = Stricture | Fistula | Abscess

explanation.intuition: Crohn causes inflammation through the entire bowel wall (transmural), explaining fistulas, strictures, and abscesses. In contrast, UC only inflames the surface. Crohn's can affect anywhere from mouth to anus in a patchy pattern.
explanation.key_insight: Transmural nature distinguishes Crohn's from UC and explains different complications. Crohn's = strictures, fistulas, abscesses. UC = bleeding, toxic megacolon, no fistulas.
explanation.technical_details: Non-caseating granulomas present in only 30% but are pathognomonic. ASCA positive in Crohn's; pANCA positive in UC.

definitions_glossary.crohn_disease: Chronic transmural granulomatous inflammation affecting any GI tract
definitions_glossary.transmural_inflammation: Through all layers of bowel wall
definitions_glossary.skip_lesions: Discontinuous inflammation with normal bowel between
definitions_glossary.granuloma: Nodular histiocyte collection; non-caseating in Crohn's
definitions_glossary.fistula: Abnormal connection between bowel and other structures

pathophysiology.mechanism: Dysregulated immune response to intestinal microbiota in genetically susceptible individuals. NOD2/CARD15 mutations associated. Th1/Th17 inflammation produces TNF-α.

definition.@value: Chronic IBD with transmural granulomatous inflammation affecting any GI tract location

clinical_pearls: Crohn = skip lesions, transmural; UC = continuous, mucosal
